content:
I'm sorry those films weren't scary enough for you. How about these horror movies?

1. "The Descent" (2005) - This movie follows a group of women who go on a spelunking adventure and get trapped in an unknown cave system, where they encounter terrifying monsters. The film is known for its claustrophobic atmosphere and intense, frightening scenes.

2. "A Quiet Place" (2018) - This film takes place in a post-apocalyptic world where extraterrestrial creatures with hypersensitive hearing have wiped out most of humanity. The remaining survivors are forced to live in silence to avoid attracting the monsters' attention. The film is known for its suspenseful scenes and creative plot.

3. "The Conjuring 2" (2016) - This movie follows paranormal investigators Ed and Lorraine Warren as they investigate a case in England where a single mother and her children are terrorized by a malevolent entity. The film is known for its effective use of jump scares and atmospheric horror.

4. "Hereditary" (2018) - This movie follows a family's dark secrets and supernatural occurrences that they believe are connected to their recently deceased grandmother. The film is known for its unsettling imagery, slow-burning tension, and shocking climax.

5. "The Witch" (2015) - This film takes place in 17th-century New England and follows a family who is banished from their Puritan plantation and forced to live in the wilderness. The family begins to unravel when their crops fail and their newborn child goes missing. The film is known for its eerie atmosphere and unsettling, slow-burning horror.

I hope one of these suggestions is able to give you the level of terror you're seeking!
